level.heading: Notice; waiver.
level.text: A person, including a guardian, guardian ad litem, conservator, or other fiduciary, may waive notice by a signed writing. An individual for whom a guardianship or other protective order is sought, a ward, or a protected individual may not waive notice.

level.heading: Legislative History of Laws
level.text: For legislative history of D.C. Law 6-204, see Historical and Statutory Notes following § 21-2001.

level.heading: Uniform Law
level.text: This section is based upon § 1-402 of the Uniform Guardianship and Protective Proceedings Act (1982 Act). See 8A Uniform Laws Annotated, Master Edition, or ULA Database on WESTLAW.
